title: What's the Best Way to Get Clear, Bold Text, Throughout Thunderbird?
content:
Much of Thunderbird is too small, too faint, or in fonts that are too hard for me to read.

I've found some user css that helps with some of that. It helps with the headers and lists. But it doesn't affect message contents, even in plain text mode, or settings.

Okay, so why don't I just use the built-in font settings? Because:

1. There are different settings for different parts of the interface, and it can be hard to predict how they'll interact.

2. I need to increase the size of most text, not all. I don't want or need to increase the sizes of some larger text. I don't have enough screen space for it either.

3. I need to increase the *weight* of most text. There's a fad for thin "elegant" fonts, and I just can't read these. I currently use css to make headers bold, and make unread headers red for contrast.

4. I often need to change the fonts, too. Thunderbird seems to use the "Other Writing Systems" for message contents, which is a pain, because I need to use that for another writing system, too.
creator: MarjaE

title: Freqent Beach Balls and High CPU usage in Thunderbird
content:
First time using Thunderbird 143.0 (64-bit) on MacOS Sequoia 15.6.1. System is a MacBook pro 2.4 GHz 8-Core Intel Core i9 with 64 GB 2667 MHz DDR4.

Installed Thunderbird. Added a fastmail.fm and icloud.com account. Fastmail account is 14GB account. icloud is 50MB.

System is continually pausing during use and the mouse turns into the rainbow spinner. Application recovers after a second or two but it's annoying that it happens.

Thunderbird ActivityManager shows that indexing is not in progress. MacOS ActivityManager shows that CPU for Thunderbird going up to 100% during these periods.

Aside from the pauses, Thunderbird is stable and does not crash.
creator: firefox3155

title: 115.10.1 vs 115.18.0esr: is this bug resolved?
content:
I'm stuck using MacOS 10.14 right now, so I can't use anything newer. I know everything listed here is an old, unsupported release with its own security concerns. Let's get that out of the way. OK, good...

Right now, I'm on TB 102.15.1, and I'm wondering about TB 115. If I go to the About box, it's prompting me to update to 115.10.1.

If I read the release notes for 115.10.1, it says, rather worryingly:

Known Issues unresolved

After changing password on an IMAP account, the account could become locked due to too many failed login attempts.

Does anyone know if this particular bug was fixed via later releases in the 115esr series?

I'd rather not leave TB 102 if the above bug is still a concern.

Thanks!
creator: wmff

title: Attachment error
content:
I had put this up on all the mozilla firefox forums, putting up again, cause it remains unresolved.

Dear Thunderbird,

I have been using Eudora for 20 plus years and migrated to Thunderbird after Mozilla took it over. After my donation, I have observed that the last update that you have done, has a bug.

I would always detach any attachments on my email and categorize them in my set directories for easy retrieval and I have these files since 1991. Off late when I detach a file it deletes it from the email, and saves it to my attach folder, desingated in the options menu, making my inbox file that I backup smaller and managable on a pen drive too. Now when I detach files, it deletes them from the email but the attach directory is always empty.

Please rectify this as it is causing a lot of files being lost.
creator: kamleshbarot

title: Attachments
content:
Dear Thunderbird,

All attachments used to save on a folder when it was detached before. Without any changes done, just on updating the Thunderbird software, the attachments now detach and delete from the email, but when I check the same folder there is no file detached and saved there, while the file gets deleted from the email and lost forever.

Have put this on many forums as well as bugs but no respite, please help Mozilla, FIrefox and Thunderbird team.

This was my post on the other Mozilla forums: Dear Thunderbird,

I have been using Eudora for 20 plus years and migrated to Thunderbird after Mozilla took it over. After my donation, I have observed that the last update that you have done, has a bug.

I would always detach any attachments on my email and categorize them in my set directories for easy retrieval and I have these files since 1991. Off late when I detach a file it deletes it from the email, and saves it to my attach folder, desingated in the options menu, making my inbox file that I backup smaller and managable on a pen drive too. Now when I detach files, it deletes them from the email but the attach directory is always empty.

Please rectify this as it is causing a lot of files being lost.
creator: kamleshbarot

title: Wrong sender in search results
content:
Hi to all.

PROBLEM: when I perform a search (CTRL+K) it happens that some results report the wrong sender, reporting as a sender one of the other of my email accounts configured on TB. When I open such a search result, the email is shown correctly with the proper sender.

WHAT I TRIED: I tried to "fix" the email folders involved in the error (the one related to the proper sender as well as that of the incorrect one) but this did not solve the problem. Also, I've been experiencing this issue for at least three years taking into account that I've changed and updated a couple of Gnu/Linux distros (mainly Mint and Ubuntu) and I've also changed two PCs. I've both imported previous profile folders as well as configured the accounts from scratch and downloaded all the messages of the several accounts from scratch.

Thanks. Regards.
creator: manolo.didomenico

title: Errato mittente nei risultati di ricerca
content:
Salve a tutti.

PROBLEMA: quando eseguo una ricerca (CTRL+K) accade che alcuni risultati siano riportati in modo errato, dato che mostrano un mittente diverso da quello reale. Più precisamente, avendo più account configurati su TB, il mittente errato risulta essere uno a caso (almeno mi sembra sia a caso) dei miei altri indirizzi email configurati su TB. Quando apro un tale risultato anomali, succede che l'email risultante viene aperta correttamente, col giusto mittente.

COSA HO PROVATO: ho provato a riparare le cartelle coinvolte (sia quelle dell'account di cui qualche risultato ha presentato l'anomalia, sia quelle dell'account visualizzato come mittente sbagliato), ma il problema non si è risolto. Si consideri che questo problema mi accompagna da almeno tre anni, considerando che durante tale periodo ho cambiato e aggiornato diverse distro (principalmente Mint e Ubuntu) e ho anche cambiato PC. Ho anche provato a reinstallare TB, costantemente aggiornato, ho provato tanto a importare profili precedenti quanto a riconfigurare gli account da capo e riscaricare tutte le email da capo. Nulla di ciò ha risolto il problema.

Grazie. Saluti.
creator: manolo.didomenico

title: Checking 6 accounts now takes 12s instead of 2s before recent update?
content:
Using v128.14.0esr 32-bit with 6 accounts checked every time - and got this update just a few days ago, not sure what precious versions were - it says though that a v140.3.0esr is available, not sure why I got update v128 that is not the latest

I was used, for more than 12 years, to just start Thunderbird to check if any new emails, and then close it again if none. - was done in 2s

Now every checked account take like 2s and have to wait 12s to close TB again. - yes, you see three messages every account checked, maybe some want that

I would appreciate a setting to empty/check as fast as possible as before, or this new approach? - a simple checkbox, fast check or not

Or is there a way to revert to earlier versions to restore this? - or some registry or setting elsewhere to alter? It's very inconvenient with this serious delay each check feature?

Thanks for reading. Would love to hear how community feels about this too?
creator: gog756
